project.title: Antenna Control Unit (ACU) Redesign
project.short_description: Redesigned a marine/vehicular satellite ACU with industrial sensors, beacon receiver, and a modular firmware architecture.

details.overview: A full redesign of a rack-mount Antenna Control Unit used in mobile satellite tracking systems for ships and trains.
goals: Improve connection stability in harsh sea conditions (up to force 10)
Replace low-grade sensors with industrial/automotive versions
Integrate a satellite beacon receiver for precise tracking
Make firmware structure modular, scalable, and portable
key_features: Beacon receiver integrated directly into PCB
Ethernet, RS485, and USB interface support
Noise-optimized PCB design with improved EMC/EMI performance

milestones.title: PCB Architecture Redesign
milestones.description: Created multi-layer board with isolated power, optimized routing, and EMC/EMI improvements.

milestones.title: Firmware Refactor
milestones.description: Modular structure added with drivers, middleware, and communication layers.

milestones.title: Sensor Fusion Implementation
milestones.description: Implemented EKF-based fusion algorithm for stability in high-vibration conditions.

milestones.title: System-Level Testing
milestones.description: Tested full ACU + antenna system in real marine conditions.

enhancements.challenge: The original antenna control unit struggled with connection stability in harsh marine conditions (up to force 10 winds), used low-grade sensors that failed in high-vibration environments, and had monolithic firmware that was difficult to maintain and scale.
enhancements.solution: We completely redesigned the system with industrial-grade sensors, implemented a 6-schedule PID loop with deterministic timing, added EKF-based sensor fusion for stability, and created a modular firmware architecture using FreeRTOS for better maintainability and scalability.

role_responsibilities.title: Firmware Architecture
role_responsibilities.description: Designed modular firmware structure with FreeRTOS, implementing drivers, middleware, and application layers

role_responsibilities.title: PCB Design & Layout
role_responsibilities.description: Created multi-layer board with optimized routing, power isolation, and EMC/EMI improvements

role_responsibilities.title: Sensor Fusion Algorithm
role_responsibilities.description: Implemented Extended Kalman Filter for gyro + accelerometer fusion in high-vibration conditions

role_responsibilities.title: System Testing
role_responsibilities.description: Conducted real-world testing in marine environments to validate performance under force 10 conditions

technical_deep_dive.title: Sensor Fusion Algorithm
technical_deep_dive.content: Implemented an Extended Kalman Filter (EKF) that combines gyroscope and accelerometer data to maintain accurate orientation tracking even in high-vibration marine environments. The algorithm runs at 1kHz with deterministic timing.

technical_deep_dive.title: PCB Layout Optimization
technical_deep_dive.content: Used a 4-layer board design with dedicated power and ground planes. Implemented star routing for power distribution and guard rings around sensitive analog components to minimize noise interference.

technical_deep_dive.title: Real-time OS Architecture
technical_deep_dive.content: Built on FreeRTOS with separate tasks for sensor reading (1kHz), control loop (500Hz), communication (100Hz), and system monitoring (10Hz). Used mutexes and queues for inter-task communication.

lessons_learned: Proper PCB grounding is critical in high-vibration environments - star grounding proved most effective
Modular firmware architecture significantly reduces debugging time and enables feature additions
Industrial-grade components, while more expensive, dramatically improve reliability in harsh conditions
Deterministic timing in control loops is essential for stable satellite tracking
